title: Why are scooters that opertate faster than 30 mph and have engines larger than 49cc, which is the limit for mopeds in NC, allowed to operate on the roads with no operater\'s license,insurance,and dmv registration?
text:
They might operate on the roads, but not legally. Scooter drivers
traveling faster than 30 mph are considered to be operating
motorcycles and face tougher state requirements. They must have a
special North Carolina driverÍs license, endorsed for motorcycles, and
they must register their vehicles and have insurance.
